Curriculum Vitae

Education

  • Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.), Electrical Engineering (Expected 2026)
    The University of Kansas, Lawrence, KS
    Advisor: Dr. Tamzidul Hoque, Assistant Professor, EECS, KU

  • Master's of Science (M.S.), Electrical Engineering (May 2025)
    The University of Kansas, Lawrence, KS
    Advisor: Dr. Tamzidul Hoque, Assistant Professor, EECS, KU

  • Bachelor of Science, Electrical and Electronic Engineering (2016 - 2021)
    Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology, Bangladesh

Professional Appointments

  • The University of Kansas - Lawrence, KS
    Graduate Research Assistant
    Jan 2022 - Aug 2024; Jan 2025 - Present
    Conducted research on hardware security, focusing on detecting and mitigating hardware Trojans in microelectronic ICs. Developed a novel Trojan detection and data protection method using side-channel analysis, leading to publications in top-tier conferences and journals.

  • The University of Kansas - Lawrence, KS
    Graduate Teaching Assistant
    Aug 2024 - Dec 2024
    Conducted lab sessions and graded assignments for undergraduate courses in digital logic and computer architecture, assisting in developing course materials and exams. Provided guidance in project-based learning using MARS MIPS and gem5 x86 simulators, enhancing student engagement and understanding.

  • NSF Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) Project - Lawrence, KS
    Research Mentor
    Summer 2025
    Mentored four undergraduate research assistants as part of the NSF-funded REU program, in collaboration with the University of Kansas and Wright State University.

  • The University of Kansas - Lawrence, KS
    Co-Instructor
    Fall 2023
    Co-taught the course "Hands-On Introduction to Computer Hardware using FPGA and Microcontroller," where I developed modules using FPGAs, simulations, and the ESP32 embedded Aha Board to teach hardware fundamentals of computer systems.

  • The University of Kansas - Lawrence, KS
    Summer Camp Instructor
    Summer 2023, 2024
    Organized and conducted summer camps teaching high school students computer hardware fundamentals through gamified, hands-on projects using FPGAs and basic electronics. Fostered an engaging learning environment to teach electronics and programming concepts.

Research Talks & Presentations

  • Leakage Unplugged - A Hands-On Tutorial on Power Side-Channel Attacks
    By Tanvir Hossain
    Presented at Research Workshop in the I2S Student Research Symposium 2025. January 2025. University of Kansas.

  • Power Side-Channel and Fault Attacks on ASCON and their Countermeasures
    By Tanvir Hossain
    Presented at Information Advantage Scholars Visit at I2S, KU. February 2024. University of Kansas.
